meanings.definition: To remove an item from a collection, especially a museum collection.
meanings.sent1: The museum will deaccession some artworks to make space for new exhibits.
meanings.sent2: It is common for museums to deaccession pieces that no longer fit their collection.
meanings.sent3: The curator decided to deaccession the old painting to make room for a more exciting display.
meanings.sent4: She felt like deaccessioning the clutter in her room was akin to clearing her mind.
meanings.sent5: The decision to deaccession the antique vase was met with mixed reactions from the staff.

meanings.definition: The act of selling or disposing of an item from a collection.
meanings.sent1: The deaccession of rare books from the library raised funds for new acquisitions.
meanings.sent2: Auction houses often handle the deaccession of valuable art pieces.
meanings.sent3: The deaccession of the outdated technology from the museum's collection was long overdue.
meanings.sent4: His deaccession of childhood toys symbolized a transition to adulthood.
meanings.sent5: The deaccession of the vintage car collection left a noticeable gap in the museum's displays.
